questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing to construct a contact tracing application that dynamically returns all the Bluetooth clients on a given Meraki network. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing to construct a Puppet manifest to configure DNS. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
https://www.pysysops.com/2016/11/10/1123-Puppet-Anti-Patterns.html
# DNS Config
class profile::base::dns{
 $dns_servers = ['192.168.1.1', '192.168.1.2']
 file { '/etc/resolv.conf':
 ensure => present,
 owner => 'root',
 group => 'root',
 mode => '0444',
 content => template('etc/resolv.conf.erb')
 }
}

comments.content:
Oh, documentation reference on the URL format, in case anybody wants to refer to it:

https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api/update-network-wireless-ssid/

discussion.content:
format of URL has changed now:

It's now: /networks/{networkId}/wireless/ssids/{number}

networks
ssids (with new API URL string, should now be: wireless/ssids )
'enabled': True
'X-Cisco-Meraki-API-Key':API_KEY
put

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing to enable an SSID by using the Cisco Meraki Dashboard API. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

choices.D: Monitors traffic flows by using an AppDynamics agent installed on a network infrastructure device.
choices.B: Retrieves a significant amount of information from the perspective of the database server by using application monitoring.
choices.C: Provides visibility into the transaction logs that can be correlated to specific business transaction requests.
choices.A: Enables instrumenting a backend web server for packet installation by using an AppDynamics agent.

discussion.content:
C is correct.

Cisco DEVCOR 350-901 Study Guide, Page 93

comments.content: It is not page 93, it is page 77 nowadays. However, by reading the question and the answer twice, that is the best option for "instrument an application" as well...

discussion.content:
A. Enables instrumenting a backend web server for packet installation by using an AppDynamics agent. Is NOT correct 
Why? This description is somewhat misleading. While AppDynamics does use agents on backend servers, it does not focus on packet installation

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.appdynamics.com/appd/23.x/latest/en/application-monitoring/business-transactions/troubleshoot-business-transaction-performance-with-transaction-snapshots/business-transactions-logging
When the tracing application code does not provide enough clues to track down the cause of a problem, AppDynamics provides visibility into the transaction logs that you can correlate to specific business transaction requests. Log correlation visibility requires a license for both Transaction Analytics and Log Analytics.

comments.content: backend is a component of AppDynamic that is not been instrumented

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The other options are incorrect. Option B is incorrect because AppDynamics does not retrieve information from the database server. Option C is incorrect because AppDynamics does not provide visibility into transaction logs. Option D is incorrect because AppDynamics does not monitor traffic flows by using an agent installed on a network infrastructure device.

Selected Answer: C
C. Provides visibility into the transaction logs that can be correlated to specific business transaction requests.

Explanation: AppDynamics is an application performance management (APM) and IT operations analytics (ITOA) company. Its software is designed to help developers monitor application performance, allowing them to identify and correct problems quickly. This includes providing visibility into business transactions, which can be used to track performance and diagnose issues.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. Enables instrumenting a backend web server for packet installation by using an AppDynamics agent.

AppDynamics is a comprehensive application performance monitoring and management tool that enables IT and business professionals to monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize complex application environments. Instrumentation is a key process in AppDynamics that enables the collection and analysis of performance data for an application.
Option C is incorrect because while AppDynamics provides visibility into transaction logs, it does not correlate them to specific business transaction requests.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. AppDynamics automatically discovers business transactions, both known and unknown. A business transaction is made up of all the required services within the environment that are called upon to fulfill and deliver a response to a user-initiated request. These are typically things like login, search, checkout, and so on, that will invoke various applications, web services, third-party APIs, and databases.

Shouldn't this be A?
https://docs.appdynamics.com/4.5.x/en/application-monitoring/install-app-server-agents
Instrumenting an application adds the AppDynamics application agent (app agent) into the runtime process of the application. This page gives you an overview of installing agents in the application environment.

C is correct
AppDynamics automatically discovers business transactions, both known and
unknown. A business transaction is made up of all the required services
within the environment that are called upon to fulfill and deliver a response to
a user-initiated request. These are typically things like login, search,
checkout, and so on, that will invoke various applications, web services,
third-party APIs, and databases.

questions.question_text: How is AppDynamics used to instrument an application?

An architect must optimize traffic that targets a popular API endpoint. Currently, the application downloads a large file hourly, but often the file is unchanged and the download causes unnecessary load and delays. Which cURL command must be used to determine the last modified date of the file and to optimize the API usage?
